Wow, so much great stuff added. The friends pass combined with the new seamless co-op with shared progression might mean I have to bully a friend into playing a co-op campaign then XD
Pretty fantastic. And yes, I loved how much movement the combat had, but sometimes the forward momentum was waaay too much. 'First Berserker Khazan' at least has a magical barrier keeping you from gravity suicide with attacks and dodges, but in LotF many people swung or stabbed themselves into a chasm at the start XD
But they addressed it, glorious. They did something similar to the overblown aggro ranges and precision for some ranged enemies (we all hate snipers in classic Soulslikes, right ?) and also the enemy density was a wee bit much. They rebalanced that, too. I think this game deserves so much more love and one of my favorite Souls Youtubers, knowing all of them, basically, loved the game too.
Gonna head in now and try out that new sound design and combat movement. Cheers to the devs !

snippet.textDisplay: Ok so here it goes. When this game out, I was really excited to play it, but soon I realized a very annoying issue in the game which I am pretty sure is not addressed even in patch 2.0, which has addressed all the gameplay related issues. I even liked how the mechanics were before the update. The major issue with this game is the illogical placement of enemies in an area. You have barely time to take in the environment and suddenly you realize you are getting swarmed by enemies without any reason. The logic of a souls-like game isn't just throwing a horde of enemies on your face rather it should be logical. Just like Elden Ring, Lies Of P, Nioh etc. The game looks beautiful, the bosses are great but going through each area feels like a task or a job. Every area I enter I was frustrated and annoyed by the sheer number of enemies who attack you continuously. Its ridiculous and really made me lose interest in travelling in any area. There is no time to take in the environment and feel the world.  If they have not addressed this issue, any mechanical change that they have done in patch 2.0 is pretty much useless.
snippet.textOriginal: Ok so here it goes. When this game out, I was really excited to play it, but soon I realized a very annoying issue in the game which I am pretty sure is not addressed even in patch 2.0, which has addressed all the gameplay related issues. I even liked how the mechanics were before the update. The major issue with this game is the illogical placement of enemies in an area. You have barely time to take in the environment and suddenly you realize you are getting swarmed by enemies without any reason. The logic of a souls-like game isn't just throwing a horde of enemies on your face rather it should be logical. Just like Elden Ring, Lies Of P, Nioh etc. The game looks beautiful, the bosses are great but going through each area feels like a task or a job. Every area I enter I was frustrated and annoyed by the sheer number of enemies who attack you continuously. Its ridiculous and really made me lose interest in travelling in any area. There is no time to take in the environment and feel the world.  If they have not addressed this issue, any mechanical change that they have done in patch 2.0 is pretty much useless.

I'll have to play again after the new update and see how all these changes feel when actually playing myself. I might be wrong, who knows

snippet.textDisplay:
The absolute MOST IMPORTANT change that needs to be made (and hey, maybe they did already is they have to decrease the power and number of mob enemies. It is legitimately, and I'm not exaggerating, the most ridiculous enemy amount I've ever seen in a souls like. Imagine Dark Souls 2, only 3 times as bad and with many, many of the enemy types repeating over and over and over again (the latter is kind of a separate complaint I suppose).  Like, on a typical boss run or moderately sized area/strip of the game, you will probably run into upwards of 30 trash mob enemies, and don't forget that you are dealing with TWO separate dimensions here between umbral lamp and regular world, not to mention there is a certain spectral/ghost enemy type in the Umbral dimension that respawns over and over again, repeatedly bothering you as you try to engage in combat with other inhabitants of the area. 

Anyway, It's just sooooooooooooo over the top and disappointing. Keep in mind, I have played pretty much every soulsborne and Souls like you can think of and was looking forward to this and Lies of P (which I was utterly blown away by btw. Best soulslike I've ever played by FAR. A borderline masterpiece) more than any other game that year by far so I am not just some blind hater. I also tried to give the game the huskiest chance of all time, playing more than half of the game before I finally gave up. Btw, giving up on ANY game especially a souls game is super unlike me, and I very, very rarely do it. 

I feel like so much of this game could be fixed with a turn of a dial. Like, just cut the mob enemies in half and make them do less damage. That alone would make an absolute WORLD of difference.

snippet.textDisplay:
Instructions on how to share progression properly.

Prerequisite: Be similar boss progress, 1 boss margin of difference tops.

Host: Set player password in Settings:Multiplayer. 

Host clicks on vestige, clicks Multiplayer and Beckon player.

Joiner: Set SAME password as Host, click vestige multiplayer, click 'join session, shared progression'

Beckon friend DOES NOT WORK, wait for Beckon player to matchmake you, do not accept invites, otherwise it fails for some reason.

Just wanted to make you aware.


Enjoy your seamless full playthrough shared progress co op.
snippet.textOriginal:
Instructions on how to share progression properly.

Prerequisite: Be similar boss progress, 1 boss margin of difference tops.

Host: Set player password in Settings:Multiplayer. 

Host clicks on vestige, clicks Multiplayer and Beckon player.

Joiner: Set SAME password as Host, click vestige multiplayer, click 'join session, shared progression'

Beckon friend DOES NOT WORK, wait for Beckon player to matchmake you, do not accept invites, otherwise it fails for some reason.

Just wanted to make you aware.


Enjoy your seamless full playthrough shared progress co op.

snippet.textDisplay: I had a game breaking bug in NG2+, asked them for a solution and they fixed it within a month. No developer has ever been this fast and it felt like they were directly listening to my suggestions. It was a bug that didn't trigger the final cutscene. I suggested that they could fix it by just giving the option of new game + the next time I opened the game, because there was no loot or anything interesting to get aside of a trophy. After said month, that's exactly what happened, and I got the tophy specific for that ending.
snippet.textOriginal: I had a game breaking bug in NG2+, asked them for a solution and they fixed it within a month. No developer has ever been this fast and it felt like they were directly listening to my suggestions. It was a bug that didn't trigger the final cutscene. I suggested that they could fix it by just giving the option of new game + the next time I opened the game, because there was no loot or anything interesting to get aside of a trophy. After said month, that's exactly what happened, and I got the tophy specific for that ending.

snippet.textDisplay: This game has some really great innovations in it to the soulslike genre,  namely the withered healing mechanic and the dual dimensional maps.   I really want to see more souls games have these features.   Playing with withered heals really prevents a lot of cheese strategies and really makes you work for your health management.   If only I could get that modded in to DS 1 to 3.
snippet.textOriginal: This game has some really great innovations in it to the soulslike genre,  namely the withered healing mechanic and the dual dimensional maps.   I really want to see more souls games have these features.   Playing with withered heals really prevents a lot of cheese strategies and really makes you work for your health management.   If only I could get that modded in to DS 1 to 3.

Everything they've listed so far were 90% of the stuff I complained about previously. Bravo! Upgrading the audio and combat is a huge improvement.

snippet.textDisplay: Honestly, I beat the game back in 2024 after classes had ended for the fall, and played lords of the fallen I hated the combat in this game, I hated the animations of my character and the parry mechanic meant nothing, I only beat the game using a broken strength build but the enemy variety was just old bosses that still took a hell of a lot of damage to take down. But I loved the atmosphere and the "Berserker armour" I had for my Guts build. The atmosphere and lore was the only thing that kept pushing me through this game. And as soon as I beat the game I uninstalled it and downloaded lies of P. But this new update looks really promising and I'll give it a shot and have a friend play with me
snippet.textOriginal: Honestly, I beat the game back in 2024 after classes had ended for the fall, and played lords of the fallen I hated the combat in this game, I hated the animations of my character and the parry mechanic meant nothing, I only beat the game using a broken strength build but the enemy variety was just old bosses that still took a hell of a lot of damage to take down. But I loved the atmosphere and the "Berserker armour" I had for my Guts build. The atmosphere and lore was the only thing that kept pushing me through this game. And as soon as I beat the game I uninstalled it and downloaded lies of P. But this new update looks really promising and I'll give it a shot and have a friend play with me

snippet.textDisplay: I think I'm the only wierdo that liked the way the dodge and movement was at launch...Especially the character movement distance when you swing a sword! I felt like I could quickly move from enemy to enemy even with a giant greatsword...I'm sure I will get used to the way it is now, I don't think it needed to be changed...All the game really needed was a few more unique weapon movesets and a little more enemy variety and it would have been perfect! Either way, I will be doing another playthrough starting this weekend and maybe I will like the changes even more after I spend some time with it...

snippet.textDisplay:
I played the game at launch and enjoyed it from start to finish. I  guess was one of the few who didn't really have any issues. Watching this 2.0  trailer made me remember how much I really enjoyed my Umbral weapons and Umbral spells.  Actually the only thing I did have issue it was that I was never able to acquire that final dlc Umbral armor set. I really wanted that. But I'd already completed the game and the path to get the armor seemed a bit convoluted. Also, the reddit forum was frequently reporting that there were issues with acquiring that armor set. Unfortunate. I was hoping there'd be some single player stuff here. Some new area or boss. But I got my money's worth.
I'll just wait for whenever they drop another Lords game.

snippet.textDisplay: My friend & I played this back when it was extremely laggy (it was awful, but we could see the potential). Then they updated it & it was actually playable. We finished the game twice because shared progression didn't exist back then. I wish From Software would copy the seamless co-op from this: it's not that I want an easier Souls experience, I just like playing with my best friend & Lords of the Fallen was great to play co-op, even with its flaws.
snippet.textOriginal: My friend & I played this back when it was extremely laggy (it was awful, but we could see the potential). Then they updated it & it was actually playable. We finished the game twice because shared progression didn't exist back then. I wish From Software would copy the seamless co-op from this: it's not that I want an easier Souls experience, I just like playing with my best friend & Lords of the Fallen was great to play co-op, even with its flaws.

snippet.textDisplay: In the end it's still a game with like 8 unique bosses and the most underwhelming ending possible. The classic ending's final boss is a complete joke and disappointment,  while the other two endings have boss reskins with repeated fights and changed colors. Every weapon of a type has the exact same moveset. And if you thought that bed of chaos was a terrible boss mechanic idea, then you should see the hollow crow in this game. Not to mention the umbral - the idea might sound cool but it has been executed so poorly that at some point you wish they've never added it to the game
snippet.textOriginal: In the end it's still a game with like 8 unique bosses and the most underwhelming ending possible. The classic ending's final boss is a complete joke and disappointment,  while the other two endings have boss reskins with repeated fights and changed colors. Every weapon of a type has the exact same moveset. And if you thought that bed of chaos was a terrible boss mechanic idea, then you should see the hollow crow in this game. Not to mention the umbral - the idea might sound cool but it has been executed so poorly that at some point you wish they've never added it to the game

snippet.textDisplay:
Absolutely insane that these devs are still improving on their game two years after release. By far the best Souls-Like game I've played. Big respect for the devs too for not just saying, "we're listening" and then doing nothing like certain other devs do, but actually listening and actually pushing those updates out in timely manners.
Big respect for fully coming out and admitting, "we know y'all like making attractive characters and our character creator doesn't really make attractive characters, so we're gonna fix that". Some devs would avoid that like the plague over sexualization fears and pushback from certain player groups, even though those groups that do get upset over stuff like that are only like, 0.1% of the community.
Absolutely huge that you'd do a Friend Pass too. Honestly, any friend of mine that wants to play this, I wouldn't even let them use the Friend Pass, I'd straight up gift them the game, sale or no sale. The devs deserve the money. They've earned the respect.
Looking forward to Lords of the Fallen 2!
snippet.textOriginal:
Absolutely insane that these devs are still improving on their game two years after release. By far the best Souls-Like game I've played. Big respect for the devs too for not just saying, "we're listening" and then doing nothing like certain other devs do, but actually listening and actually pushing those updates out in timely manners.
Big respect for fully coming out and admitting, "we know y'all like making attractive characters and our character creator doesn't really make attractive characters, so we're gonna fix that". Some devs would avoid that like the plague over sexualization fears and pushback from certain player groups, even though those groups that do get upset over stuff like that are only like, 0.1% of the community.
Absolutely huge that you'd do a Friend Pass too. Honestly, any friend of mine that wants to play this, I wouldn't even let them use the Friend Pass, I'd straight up gift them the game, sale or no sale. The devs deserve the money. They've earned the respect.
Looking forward to Lords of the Fallen 2!

snippet.textDisplay:
My sense of direction has always been god awful I could take one turn and that's it I'm lost but i also hate missing things so taking every corner searching ever nook and cranny is just something that i have to do so getting lost simply comes with the packageüòÇHearing that the umbral lamp being able to show you where to go is a god send for me, no more wasting time running around in circles for hours i can now explore without the fear of not being able to find the way forward again. The movement update is also just the cherry on top. Like most people i was playing Elden ring when this game first came out and one small thing that thoroughly irritated me was losing the ability to jump whenever I wanted which is funny given that pretty much all souls like games don't have that ability but when Elden ring introduced it, it just felt right, 

it has been like a year since I've played this game I cant remember how far I got but apparently I have 75 hours not sure if that's far or not I doubt it as half of that time is probably just me being lostüòÇbut yh i think now ill finally get back on it

snippet.textDisplay:
The game has/had its rough edges but the developers are truly amazing! They might be partially industry veterans but for the studio as a whole this was their debut title.
And their dedication to listen to player feedback and improve the game over so many different patches over such a long period of time deserves the highest praise. Not only to Hexworks but to the publisher CI Games as well for supporting such an effort.

In addition over 4.5 million sold units is not a bad number either. I am so happy that the game was that successful. <3

Better late than never. I'll have to try it again.

snippet.textDisplay:
I beat the game a few times, and enjoyed what it offered. It's not the greatest game in the world. but it was still enjoyable. The majority of the updates mentioned in this video I shared similar sentiment on things I would look to improve (the more attractive character thing is a bit weird, but sure,. why not).

if you go into this game expecting From Software quality, you'd be disappointed, but if you are looking for a decent to fairly good Souls-like game, I would recommend it, especially with the co-op improvements.

snippet.textDisplay:
Every single thing is fire besides the lantern showing where vestiges are......do we really need a go here arrow to tell people where checkpoints are? The entirety point of the level design in souls likes is to be half hp with no flasks wondering down dangerous paths trying to find the next checkpoint with out dying.

Telling people where to go not only lowers the value of exploration, it practically will cause people to just skip entire areas.

snippet.textDisplay:
3:40 People do not fully appreciate how important audio is to games.

Sure a lot of praise gets heaped on soundtracks/music BUT what can make a game feel satisfying is sound effects. Particularly metal clangs, explosions, and squishes.

Great example that comes to mind is the Bolter from Space Marine 1.
snippet.textOriginal:
3:40 People do not fully appreciate how important audio is to games.

Great example that comes to mind is the Bolter from Space Marine 1.

snippet.textDisplay: Damn, I played through the entire thing as a STR/RAD character when it was a still a broken mess, then didn't touch it again (dual wielding holy maces is fun as hell). I need to jump back in with a long-range character. But, it's a testament to how good the game is that I still kept playing even with the massive slowdown issues, frame rate drops and annoying lock-on issues. I lost track of the number of times I died in umbral because the game refused to lock on to the one enemy I needed to kill to stop being swarmed.

snippet.textDisplay: So far so good, I've played this game from release to now and it definitely needed alot of these updates. I'm not the biggest fan of having the experience being shared being forced onto both players. I join people to help knowing the progress I make in their game won't carry over in my game so I can come back and play my own game. Having whatever progress someone else has made can ultimately effect endings, etc I may want to get that the host may not want to get. Other then this I think this is a great update.

snippet.textDisplay:
This is exactly what the industry needs. Gamers and studios need to see a game respond to negativity with resolved determination to do one thing: make the game better.

I hope that Lords of the Fallen becomes the next story of triumph like No Man's Sky and Cyberpunk. They've clearly put in the effort, and they deserve the praise and recognition for both the effort itself and the result we've been given.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: This has been Techland/Dying Light levels of support and listening to players, and you can really see the passion for this IP. Has me really hyped for the sequel and you can tell they‚Äôre giving it their all when we‚Äôre getting this level of updates almost 2 years post launch. Love to see it and they earned my money. Loved this game as well, played it at launch and once after the 1.5 update and if anyone slept on this or passed at launch, it‚Äôs solid now and honestly a great soulslike that scratches that dark fantasy itch. And the Umbral mechanic really is a game changer for exploration feeling fresh. Well worth your time.
snippet.textOriginal: This has been Techland/Dying Light levels of support and listening to players, and you can really see the passion for this IP. Has me really hyped for the sequel and you can tell they‚Äôre giving it their all when we‚Äôre getting this level of updates almost 2 years post launch. Love to see it and they earned my money. Loved this game as well, played it at launch and once after the 1.5 update and if anyone slept on this or passed at launch, it‚Äôs solid now and honestly a great soulslike that scratches that dark fantasy itch. snippet.textDisplay: A game I hated when I first played it and put it down after Spurned Progeny. I ignored it until I, out of pure spite, I wanted to unlock all achievements and leave a negative steam review. From spite to genuine enjoyment, the game really won me over (I imagine the 50+ updates may have had something to do with my altered opinion lol). Glad to see such good changes being brought to the game. The dev team should be proud of how they turned the game around for the better.
snippet.textOriginal: A game I hated when I first played it and put it down after Spurned Progeny. I ignored it until I, out of pure spite, I wanted to unlock all achievements and leave a negative steam review. From spite to genuine enjoyment, the game really won me over (I imagine the 50+ updates may have had something to do with my altered opinion lol). Glad to see such good changes being brought to the game. The dev team should be proud of how they turned the game around for the better.

snippet.textDisplay: This is incredible, man. After No Man's Sky and Cyberpunk 2077 this is THE redemption arc story in gaming. The game, even at launch, had a really cool art style, interesting tale to tell, and some cool ideas. Everything else was pretty damn bad, though, chiefly combat, enemy placement, and navigation. To think that they then spent like two years, making EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THESE THINGS infinitely better, all while listening intently to player feedback is kind of crazy in this day and age. This is now legitimately a top 3 Soulslike game out there, and something everyone really needs to check out. And that's coming from someone who gave it like a 5/10 originally, at best.
snippet.textOriginal: This is incredible, man. After No Man's Sky and Cyberpunk 2077 this is THE redemption arc story in gaming. To think that they then spent like two years, making EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THESE THINGS infinitely better, all while listening intently to player feedback is kind of crazy in this day and age. This is now legitimately a top 3 Soulslike game out there, and something everyone really needs to check out. And that's coming from someone who gave it like a 5/10 originally, at best.

snippet.textDisplay: I always knew that this game was a top notch dark fantasy action rpg from the begging. Everyone said: ''nooo, this is a sh@t game, don't buy it''; I did buy it at launch and, I love it. The visual, gameplay and story. Thank you for supporting this game to this far. That is a company that LISTEN to your customers and not to their MONEY.
